sample_001.title: Applying intersectional multilevel analysis of individual heterogeneity and discriminatory accuracy (MAIHDA) to investigate health inequalities
sample_001.authors: Evans, C.R., Williams, D.R., Onnela, J.P., Subramanian, S.V.
sample_001.abstract: This paper introduces MAIHDA as a novel quantitative intersectional methodology for analyzing health disparities across multiple intersecting social positions.

sample_002.title: The MAIHDA approach for studying intersectional health inequalities in education settings
sample_002.abstract: Application of MAIHDA methodology to understand educational achievement gaps through an intersectional lens.

sample_003.title: Spatial extensions to MAIHDA: Incorporating geographic heterogeneity
sample_003.abstract: This paper extends the MAIHDA framework to include spatial dependencies and geographic clustering effects.
